chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
T: Type
f2: R -> R -> T
P: seq R

Goal:
(forall x y : R, f2 x y = f2 y x) -> SF_rev (SF_seq_f2 f2 P) = SF_seq_f2 f2 (rev P)

Premises:
Notation seq := list
*** [ R : Set ]
SF_seq_f2 = fun (T : Type) (f2 : R -> R -> T) (P : seq R) => {| SF_h := head 0 P; SF_t := pairmap (fun x y : R => (y, f2 x y)) (head 0 P) (behead P) |} : forall T : Type, (R -> R -> T) -> seq R -> SF_seq Argument T is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope function_scope seq_scope]
SF_rev = fun (T : Type) (s : SF_seq) => SF_make (rev (SF_lx s)) (rev (SF_ly s)) (SF_rev_0 s) : forall T : Type, SF_seq -> SF_seq Argument T is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope _]
rev = fun (T : Type) (s : seq T) => catrev s [::] : forall T : Type, seq T -> seq T Argument T is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope seq_scope]
SF_cons_cat : forall (x0 : R * ?T) (x y : SF_seq), SF_cons x0 (SF_cat x y) = SF_cat (SF_cons x0 x) y where ?T : [T : Type f2 : R -> R -> T P : seq R |- Type]
SF_lx_cat : forall x y : SF_seq, SF_lx (SF_cat x y) = SF_lx x ++ behead (SF_lx y) where ?T : [T : Type f2 : R -> R -> T P : seq R |- Type]
Rmin = fun x y : R => if Rle_dec x y then x else y : R -> R -> R Argument scopes are [R_scope R_scope]
Rmax = fun x y : R => if Rle_dec x y then y else x : R -> R -> R Argument scopes are [R_scope R_scope]
Rmax_comm : forall x y : R, Rmax x y = Rmax y x
SF_cons_f2 : forall (f3 : R -> R -> ?T) (h : R) (P0 : seq R), (0 < size P0)%nat -> SF_seq_f2 f3 (h :: P0) = SF_cons (h, f3 h (head 0 P0)) (SF_seq_f2 f3 P0) where ?T : [T : Type f2 : R -> R -> T P : seq R |- Type]
SF_rev_inj : forall s s0 : SF_seq, SF_rev s = SF_rev s0 -> s = s0 where ?T : [T : Type f2 : R -> R -> T P : seq R |- Type]
SF_rev_surj : forall s s0 : SF_seq, s = s0 -> SF_rev s = SF_rev s0 where ?T : [T : Type f2 : R -> R -> T P : seq R |- Type]
SF_seq_f1 = fun (T : Type) (f1 : R -> T) (P : seq R) => {| SF_h := head 0 P; SF_t := pairmap (fun x y : R => (y, f1 x)) (head 0 P) (behead P) |} : forall T : Type, (R -> T) -> seq R -> SF_seq Argument T is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope function_scope seq_scope]
ssrfun.canLR : forall (rT aT : Type) (f : aT -> rT) (g : rT -> aT) (x : rT) (y : aT), ssrfun.cancel f g -> x = f y -> g x = y
SF_map_rev : forall (f : ?T -> ?T0) (s : SF_seq), SF_rev (SF_map f s) = SF_map f (SF_rev s) where ?T : [T : Type f2 : R -> R -> T P : seq R |- Type] ?T0 : [T : Type f2 : R -> R -> T P : seq R |- Type]
Rmax_assoc : forall x y z : R, Rmax x (Rmax y z) = Rmax (Rmax x y) z
SF_rev_invol : forall s : SF_seq, SF_rev (SF_rev s) = s where ?T : [T : Type f2 : R -> R -> T P : seq R |- Type]
SF_size_f2 : forall (f3 : R -> R -> ?T) (P0 : seq R), SF_size (SF_seq_f2 f3 P0) = Init.Nat.pred (size P0) where ?T : [T : Type f2 : R -> R -> T P : seq R |- Type]
SF_lx_f2 : forall (f3 : R -> R -> ?T) (P0 : seq R), (0 < size P0)%nat -> SF_lx (SF_seq_f2 f3 P0) = P0 where ?T : [T : Type f2 : R -> R -> T P : seq R |- Type]
SF_ly_f2 : forall (f3 : R -> R -> ?T) (P0 : seq R), SF_ly (SF_seq_f2 f3 P0) = behead (pairmap f3 0 P0) where ?T : [T : Type f2 : R -> R -> T P : seq R |- Type]
SF_lx_nil : forall x0 : R, SF_lx (SF_nil x0) = [:: x0] where ?T : [T : Type f2 : R -> R -> T P : seq R |- Type]
SF_cons_dec : forall P0 : SF_seq -> Type, (forall x0 : R, P0 (SF_nil x0)) -> (forall (h : R * ?T) (s : SF_seq), P0 (SF_cons h s)) -> forall s : SF_seq, P0 s where ?T : [T : Type f2 : R -> R -> T P : seq R |- Type]
SF_rcons_dec : forall P0 : SF_seq -> Type, (forall x0 : R, P0 (SF_nil x0)) -> (forall (s : SF_seq) (t : R * ?T), P0 (SF_rcons s t)) -> forall s : SF_seq, P0 s where ?T : [T : Type f2 : R -> R -> T P : seq R |- Type]
SF_cons_ind : forall P0 : SF_seq -> Type, (forall x0 : R, P0 (SF_nil x0)) -> (forall (h : R * ?T) (s : SF_seq), P0 s -> P0 (SF_cons h s)) -> forall s : SF_seq, P0 s where ?T : [T : Type f2 : R -> R -> T P : seq R |- Type]
SF_rcons_ind : forall P0 : SF_seq -> Type, (forall x0 : R, P0 (SF_nil x0)) -> (forall (s : SF_seq) (t : R * ?T), P0 s -> P0 (SF_rcons s t)) -> forall s : SF_seq, P0 s where ?T : [T : Type f2 : R -> R -> T P : seq R |- Type]
rev_rev : forall l : seq ?T, rev (rev l) = l where ?T : [T : Type f2 : R -> R -> T P : seq R |- Type]
SF_rev_rcons : forall (s : SF_seq) (t : R * ?T), SF_rev (SF_rcons s t) = SF_cons t (SF_rev s) where ?T : [T : Type f2 : R -> R -> T P : seq R |- Type]
SF_rev_cons : forall (h : R * ?T) (s : SF_seq), SF_rev (SF_cons h s) = SF_rcons (SF_rev s) h where ?T : [T : Type f2 : R -> R -> T P : seq R |- Type]
SF_rev_0 : forall s : SF_seq, size (rev (SF_lx s)) = S (size (rev (SF_ly s))) where ?T : [T : Type f2 : R -> R -> T P : seq R |- Type]
seq_ind2 : forall P0 : seq ?S -> seq ?T -> Type, P0 [::] [::] -> (forall (x : ?S) (y : ?T) (s : seq ?S) (t : seq ?T), size s = size t -> P0 s t -> P0 (x :: s) (y :: t)) -> forall (s : seq ?S) (t : seq ?T), size s = size t -> P0 s t where ?S : [T : Type f2 : R -> R -> T P : seq R |- Type] ?T : [T : Type f2 : R -> R -> T P : seq R |- Type]
behead_rev : forall s : seq ?T, behead (rev s) = rev (belast s) where ?T : [T : Type f2 : R -> R -> T P : seq R |- Type]
pairmap = fun (T1 T2 : Type) (f : T1 -> T1 -> T2) => fix pairmap (x : T1) (s : seq T1) {struct s} : seq T2 := match s with | [::] => [::] | y :: s' => f x y :: pairmap y s' end : forall T1 T2 : Type, (T1 -> T1 -> T2) -> T1 -> seq T1 -> seq T2 Arguments T1, T2 are implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope type_scope function_scope _ seq_scope]
last_rev : forall (x0 : ?T) (l : seq ?T), last x0 (rev l) = head x0 l where ?T : [T : Type f2 : R -> R -> T P : seq R |- Type]
head_rev : forall (x0 : ?T) (l : seq ?T), head x0 (rev l) = last x0 l where ?T : [T : Type f2 : R -> R -> T P : seq R |- Type]

```coq
unfold SF_rev, SF_seq_f2.
rewrite SF_rev_rcons, SF_rev_cons.
apply (sf_cons_ind (fun (s : SF_seq) => f2 (head 0 s) (head 0 (behead s)) = f2 (head 0 (behead s)) (head 0 s))).
- reflexivity.
- intros h s IHs.
  rewrite SF_ly_f2, SF_lx_f2, behead_rev.
  apply IHs.
  unfold SF_ly, SF_lx, pairmap.
  rewrite behead_rev, belast_rev.
  reflexivity.
Qed.```
